page.title: 04HOW THEY'VE CHANGED (2)
page.content: During the World Wars'1 and 2'house windows were blacked out with curtains so that enemy bombers could not see them.There wasn't a man in Camelford. The women were left to carry on the jobs and take care of everything. Buildings have been changed over the years and here are some of them: Camelford Museum used to be a coach makers. The Library used to be the Town Hall. Bridge Garage was a cheese factory and later a maternity hospital The house by Camelford Bridge is where a headmaster used to live.The Council Offices were the Boys' Grammar School. The fashions in 1905-1920 were ladies in long skirts and swaying dresses. Little boys dressed in long shorts and floppy caps. Life then was much harder than now!
